overview_summary: All five profiled neighbors have no recorded public stance on local development, with each classified as "unknown" in the absence of explicit statements or actions. Community influence among them is generally low; only one neighbor holds a notable public role (a police officer), while the others are private residents with limited public profiles.

neighbors.name: Ernest E. Wolfe & Deborah A. Wolfe
neighbors.claims: Ernest E. Wolfe and his wife Deborah A. Wolfe jointly own a parcel in Hardy County, WV, reflected as a life estate arrangement involving their family ([hardylive.com](https://hardylive.com/2025/09/16/public-hearing-reveals-divide-on-agriculture-language-in-draft-comprehensive-plan/#:~:text=The%20Hardy%20County%20Commission%20held,that%20will%20guide%20future%20development)) ([hardylive.com](https://hardylive.com/2025/09/16/public-hearing-reveals-divide-on-agriculture-language-in-draft-comprehensive-plan/#:~:text=That%20distinction%20has%20become%20a,restrictions%20on%20large%20poultry%20operations)). No public records of either Ernest or Deborah holding local office or speaking in recent county meetings could be found ([hardylive.com](https://hardylive.com/2025/09/16/public-hearing-reveals-divide-on-agriculture-language-in-draft-comprehensive-plan/#:~:text=%E2%80%9CThis%20is%20not%20a%20regulatory,%E2%80%9D)) ([hardylive.com](https://hardylive.com/2025/09/16/public-hearing-reveals-divide-on-agriculture-language-in-draft-comprehensive-plan/#:~:text=Several%20residents%20noted%20concerns%20about,in%20the%20Old%20Fields%20area)). They have not been identified in news reports or public debates related to development or energy projects in the area ([hardylive.com](https://hardylive.com/2025/09/16/public-hearing-reveals-divide-on-agriculture-language-in-draft-comprehensive-plan/#:~:text=%E2%80%9CThis%20is%20not%20a%20regulatory,%E2%80%9D)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach respectfully through personal outreach, emphasizing how any plans can align with preserving their family land use and quiet rural lifestyle.

neighbors.name: Kevin M. Helmick II
neighbors.claims: Kevin M. Helmick II serves as a police officer in Moorefield and was highlighted for his role as a K9 handler and drug recognition expert with the Moorefield Police Department ([www.wv.ng.mil](https://www.wv.ng.mil/News/Article/2408406/helmick-named-wvng-soldier-spotlight-for-november-2020/#:~:text=partner%2C%20Riso,%28Courtesy%20photo%20provided)). In late 2024, he was at the center of a local controversy after being fired and then suspended from the police force, prompting his family to protest at a town council meeting ([www.whsv.com](https://www.whsv.com/2024/12/04/moorefield-town-council-holds-monthly-meeting/#:~:text=Several%20family%20members%20of%20Moorefield,Winnie%20Helmick%20told%20the%20council)) ([www.whsv.com](https://www.whsv.com/2024/12/04/moorefield-town-council-holds-monthly-meeting/#:~:text=finds%20to%20be%20unfair%20reasoning,has%20been%20disrespected%20and%20mistreated)). Aside from law enforcement-related news, there is no public record of Helmick taking a stance on development or participating in land use debates in Hardy County.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via a community safety perspective. Given his law enforcement background, emphasize open communication and how project plans address local safety and traffic concerns.

neighbors.name: Wayne A. Hudson & Sharon M. Hudson
neighbors.claims: Wayne A. Hudson and his spouse Sharon M. Hudson own property in Hardy County but maintain a low public profile ([hardylive.com](https://hardylive.com/2025/09/16/public-hearing-reveals-divide-on-agriculture-language-in-draft-comprehensive-plan/#:~:text=The%20Hardy%20County%20Commission%20held,that%20will%20guide%20future%20development)). No evidence was found of either holding any public office or speaking out at county meetings or hearings ([hardylive.com](https://hardylive.com/2025/09/16/public-hearing-reveals-divide-on-agriculture-language-in-draft-comprehensive-plan/#:~:text=%E2%80%9CThis%20is%20not%20a%20regulatory,%E2%80%9D)). They have not been mentioned in local news regarding development, indicating no visible involvement in community disputes or advocacy on such issues.

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out in a neighborly manner through personal contact. Emphasize listening to any concerns they have about property or infrastructure to build trust, since they are not publicly outspoken.

neighbors.name: Raymond Lee Orndorff III (Trustee for Alexis Rae Orndorff)
neighbors.claims: This parcel is held in a trust arrangement: Raymond Lee Orndorff III is listed as trustee on behalf of Alexis Rae Orndorff ([www.giffinfuneralhome.com](https://www.giffinfuneralhome.com/obituaries/obituary-listings?obId=24509126#:~:text=Obituary%20information%20for%20Orpha%20H,3521%20%C2%A9Giffin%20Funeral%20Home%20Inc)). Alexis Rae (“Lexi”) Orndorff is a younger family member; a WVU Medicine profile notes an Alexis Orndorff from the area pursuing nursing after overcoming a childhood illness ([medicine.wvu.edu](https://medicine.wvu.edu/News/Story?headline=first-hand-experience-with-cancer-inspires-keyser-campus-nursing-student-to-help-others#:~:text=When%20she%20was%20in%20kindergarten%2C,she%20was%20diagnosed%20with%20leukemia)) ([medicine.wvu.edu](https://medicine.wvu.edu/News/Story?headline=first-hand-experience-with-cancer-inspires-keyser-campus-nursing-student-to-help-others#:~:text=%E2%80%9CI%20was%20around%2011%20in,%E2%80%9D)). Neither the trustee nor the beneficiary have any documented involvement in local political or planning matters, and no public comments on development have been found.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via personal connection through family networks. Emphasize how any development proposal can respect their family’s long-term legacy and future plans for the land.

neighbors.name: Amber N. King, David A. King & Rosemary E. King
neighbors.claims: Amber N. King, David A. King, and Rosemary E. King jointly own their Hardy County parcel, suggesting a multi-generational family ownership ([hardylive.com](https://hardylive.com/2025/09/16/public-hearing-reveals-divide-on-agriculture-language-in-draft-comprehensive-plan/#:~:text=Scott%20noted%20that%20agriculture%20has,of%20whose%20members%20are%20farmers)). There are no public news articles or meeting records that mention the King family with regard to development or civic issues in the county ([hardylive.com](https://hardylive.com/2025/09/16/public-hearing-reveals-divide-on-agriculture-language-in-draft-comprehensive-plan/#:~:text=%E2%80%9CThis%20is%20not%20a%20regulatory,%E2%80%9D)). They have not publicly advocated for or against land development, and none of the Kings appear in local leadership roles or community boards as per available records.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage through a family-oriented approach. Reaching out via a community gathering or introduction by a mutual acquaintance may help, focusing on listening to any family concerns or needs.
